text.text: What is the purpose of the Merge Patients functionality in ZOLL Billing?

text: The Merge Patients functionality in ZOLL Billing is used to consolidate multiple patient records into one patient record. This is useful when there are duplicate patient records that have been created due to similar names, dates of birth, or addresses.

text.text: How do you know if there are possible duplicate patient records in ZOLL Billing?

text: ZOLL Billing uses a weighted algorithm to determine if a new patient record is a match of an existing patient record. The algorithm gives points to each matching criteria, such as social security number, date of birth, and personal information. If a possible duplicate exists, the system presents the patient data and asks you to choose the correct information.

text.text: Can you describe the process of merging patient records in ZOLL Billing?

text: To merge patient records in ZOLL Billing, you can use the Merge Patients functionality. This functionality allows you to consolidate as many patient records as you wish into one patient record. To merge patient records, you can: Check the list of existing patient records, and if you see a match, select it. If you don't see a match, select Nope to create a new patient record.

text.text: What information is displayed on the "Merge patients" page?

text: The Merge Patients page displays two columns. The first column shows the demographics of the patient on the account you were viewing. The second column shows the demographics of the patient you are merging with.

text.text: What is the significance of resolving conflicts under the "Coordination of benefits" heading before merging patient records?

text: If the data used for the same payer differs in some respect, you will see a conflict. This conflict will need to be resolved before you can merge the records.

text.text: How do you view the merge history of patient records in ZOLL Billing?

text: To view the merge history of patient records, you can click View merge history at the top right of the patient's Account page. The page will display a list of merged patient records for the account you are viewing.

text.text: When does the "View merge history" link display on the Account page?

text: The "View merge history" link will display at the top right corner of the Account page if the record was created by the merging of one or more duplicate records but currently no more duplicates exist.

text.text: Can you explain how to restore a merged patient record in ZOLL Billing?

text:
To restore a merged patient record in ZOLL Billing, you can follow these steps:
1. Go to the patient's Account page.
2. Click View merge history at the top right of the page.
3. Click the Restore link next to the record you want to restore.
4. Click OK to confirm the restoration.

text.text: What information is included in the merge history page for a patient account?

text: The merge history page for a patient account displays a list of all merged patient records, including their: Account number, name, address, SSN, and DOB

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle claims associated with merged patient records?

text: When you merge patient records, all claims associated with the records remain the same. Users working the claims associated with the merge will still see the claim, with the same claim number, in their Inbox.

text.text: What actions can users take after merging patient records to ensure data integrity?

text: Users can merge as many patient records as needed until all the duplicates are gone. After clicking Merge, the new patient account created by the two merged patient records will display. If there are additional duplicate records, the "View similar records" banner will continue to display.

text.text: How does the Merge Patients functionality contribute to streamlining workflow and reducing data redundancy in ZOLL Billing?

text: The Merge Patients functionality allows users to merge duplicate patient records into one patient record with a new patient ID. This reduces data redundancy and streamlines workflow by eliminating the need to manage multiple patient records.

text.text: Are there any limitations or considerations users should be aware of when using the Merge Patients feature?

text: When a duplicate is detected, a warning banner displays on top of the page. You can only select one record at a time to merge into the existing patient record.

text.text: Can you describe any potential challenges users might face when merging patient records, and how they can be addressed?

text: When the merge is complete, the merge history page for patient account displays a list of all merged patient records including their account number, name, address, SSN, and DOB. Users working the claims associated with the merge will still see the claim, with the same claim number in their Inbox.
You can view a list of records that were merged by clicking View merge history.

text.text: How to restore merged patient records?

text: You can restore a merged patient record at any time after it is merged with another. To restore a record, you need to go to the patient's Account page and click the View merge history link. The page displays a list of merged patient records for the account you are viewing. You can find the record you want to restore and then click the Restore patient button.

To merge patients, you can use Merge Patients to consolidate as many patient records as you wish into one patient record. When you merge patient records, all claims associated with the records remain the same. Users working the claims associated with the merge will still see the claim, with the same claim number, in their Inbox.
